task_summary: Detect the T-block, align the circular end-effector, push it along a straight direction toward the goal, and retreat.

task_long_description.overview: A tabletop robot with a circular end-effector must push a T-shaped block across a white workspace to a designated target region. The sequence begins with perception to locate the block, followed by an overhead approach and yaw alignment for a planar push. The robot performs a straight push with moderate distance, then retreats and waits briefly. Contact-rich grasping is not required; precision alignment ensures sliding without toppling. Visual feedback is used to confirm visibility before motion. Safety timeouts are used on motion leaves.
preconditions: Workspace is clear except for the T-block and a target mark
Camera provides view of the block
Robot is homed and within reach of the workspace
stepwise_plan: Move above the block at a safe offset
Set tool yaw aligned with push direction
Approach and align to the push start pose
Execute a straight push of fixed distance
success_criteria: T-block translated in the commanded direction by the planned distance
No object topples or exits workspace
Robot ends clear of the block
failure_and_recovery: If DetectObject fails, perform a raster ScanForTarget
If visibility is lost, re-detect then continue
If alignment times out, retry the approach step
If push is obstructed, abort and retreat
task_long_description.termination: Tree terminates after retreat and wait once the push action completes or any unrecoverable failure occurs.

frame_3.now_evidence: End-effector is directly over the block indicating approach completion and imminent contact.
frame_3.predicts_next: A straight push is expected after this alignment.

task_instruction: The task requires pushing a T-shaped block (gray) to a fixed target (green) with a circular end-effector (blue). Both observation and control frequencies are 10Hz.

node_specs.description: Raster scan if direct detection fails.
Verify the block is visible before motion.
Hover above the block at safe height.
Align tool yaw with push direction (south).
Lateral approach and fine alignment for pushing.
Execute straight push along table negative Y.
Back away to clear the object.
Brief settle time at the end.

failure_modes: Push obstructed or friction too high
assumptions: Contact sheet shows a red T-block rather than gray; treated as the same object.
Green target is not clearly visible; push direction chosen as 270Â° (south) based on observed motion.
10 Hz observation/control noted but not explicitly encoded in BT; handled by controller outside this tree.

expected_success_criteria: Block translated roughly one block width toward target
Robot ends clear of the block
